events.message: The customer reported a vehicle collision that occurred at the intersection resulting in damage to the car's front bumper and hood.
The claim was categorised under auto accident based on the description of the car collision and damages provided.
An insurance agent was assigned promptly to the case to ensure immediate support and guidance for the claimant.
The insurance company sent an acknowledgment email confirming receipt of the claim and outlining the next steps.
The claimant was requested to submit photos of the damaged vehicle, the police report, and a copy of the driver’s license.
All required documents, including the police report and vehicle damage photos, were submitted by the claimant ahead of schedule.
The investigation team began verifying the authenticity of the documents and assessing the damage to the vehicle.
The investigation concluded that the accident and damage are consistent with the claimant’s statements and documents.
A settlement offer was proposed to the claimant covering repairs and other eligible expenses according to the policy.
The claimant responded positively to the settlement proposal, expressing satisfaction with the speed and communication.
The claim was officially approved after the claimant accepted the settlement terms without any objections.
Payment covering the repair costs was issued and processed to the claimant’s bank account successfully.
The claim was closed following successful payment and confirmation from the claimant that repairs have been completed.
All claim documents and correspondence were archived securely for future reference and compliance purposes.
